title: Exodus Chapter 31 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 31 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 31 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 31.

questions.question: Who did the LORD call by name to be filled with the spirit of God for workmanship?
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:2 states that the LORD called Bezaleel by name.

questions.question: According to Exodus 31:3, what qualities was Bezaleel filled with?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom, understanding, knowledge, workmanship
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:3 says God filled Bezaleel with the spirit of God, wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and workmanship.

questions.question: Which materials was Bezaleel skilled to work in, as mentioned in Exodus 31?
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, stones, timber
questions.explanation: Verses 4 and 5 describe Bezaleel's skill in gold, silver, brass, cutting stones, and carving timber.

questions.question: Who was given alongside Bezaleel to help with the workmanship?
questions.correctAnswer: Aholiab
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:6 states that Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, was given to help Bezaleel.

questions.question: From which tribe was Aholiab, as mentioned in Exodus 31?
questions.correctAnswer: Dan
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:6 indicates Aholiab was from the tribe of Dan.

questions.question: What did God put into the hearts of all that are wise-hearted?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:6 explains God put wisdom into the hearts of all wise-hearted.

questions.question: According to Exodus 31:7-10, which of the following items was NOT mentioned as part of the tabernacle furnishings?
questions.correctAnswer: The golden calf
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:7-10 lists tabernacle items but does not mention the golden calf.

questions.question: What is the sabbath described as in Exodus 31:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Holy unto you
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:14 states the sabbath is holy unto the people.

questions.question: What is the penalty for working on the sabbath according to Exodus 31:15?
options: The soul shall be put to death
Rest is required the next day
questions.correctAnswer: The soul shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:15 warns that whoever works on the sabbath shall be put to death.

questions.question: How long did God make the heaven and earth before resting, according to Exodus 31:17?
questions.correctAnswer: Six days
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:17 states God made heaven and earth in six days and rested on the seventh.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 31:13, the sabbath is a sign between God and the children of Israel throughout their generations.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 confirms the sabbath is a sign between God and Israel throughout generations.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 31:18 states that Moses received the tablets of stone written with the finger of God after communing with Him on Mount Sinai.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:18 describes Moses receiving two stone tablets written by God's finger.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 31:16 says the children of Israel shall keep the sabbath only for one generation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:16 states the sabbath is to be kept throughout generations as a perpetual covenant.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Exodus 31:4: 'To devise cunning works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in ______,'
questions.correctAnswer: brass
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:4 says to work in gold, silver, and brass.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Exodus 31:13: 'Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your ______;'
questions.correctAnswer: generations
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 states the sabbath is a sign between God and Israel throughout their generations.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 31 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 31 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 teach us about the importance of using God-given gifts in our work and service?
options: By showing that God filled Bezaleel with wisdom and skill to build the tabernacle
By commanding the people to rest on the Sabbath
By emphasizing the punishment for working on the Sabbath
By describing the anointing oil and incense
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that God filled Bezaleel with wisdom and skill to build the tabernacle
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:2-6 explains how God called Bezaleel and Aholiab, filling them with the Spirit of God, wisdom, understanding, and knowledge to perform skilled work. This teaches us to use our God-given talents faithfully in service. (Exodus 31:2-6)

questions.question: A fellow believer feels inadequate about their work skills. What biblical truth from Exodus 31 could encourage them?
options: God equips those He calls with wisdom and skill for their tasks
Resting on the Sabbath is the most important command
Only priests are chosen for special work
Work is only meaningful if done in gold and silver
questions.correctAnswer: God equips those He calls with wisdom and skill for their tasks
questions.explanation: God’s choice of Bezaleel and Aholiab and the wisdom given to all the wise-hearted (Exodus 31:3-6) shows that God equips believers with the necessary skills for their assigned work, encouraging trust in His provision and calling.

questions.question: Based on Exodus 31, what does keeping the Sabbath teach us about our relationship with God?
options: It is a sign between God and His people showing He sanctifies them
It is only a suggestion for rest
It is a way to earn salvation
It is unrelated to God’s creative work
questions.correctAnswer: It is a sign between God and His people showing He sanctifies them
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 states that the Sabbath is a sign between God and Israel, signifying that God sanctifies them. It reflects the relationship of holiness and obedience in God’s covenant.

questions.question: If someone struggles with balancing work and rest, what principle from Exodus 31 would you share?
options: Work for six days and rest on the seventh because the Sabbath is holy
Work continuously without rest to please God
Only priests need to rest on the Sabbath
Work and rest have no connection to God’s commands
questions.correctAnswer: Work for six days and rest on the seventh because the Sabbath is holy
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:15 teaches that work is to be done six days, but the seventh is a holy Sabbath of rest dedicated to the LORD, emphasizing the balance of diligent work and sacred rest.

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 instruct believers to view Sabbath observance in terms of obedience and consequences?
options: Keeping the Sabbath is mandatory, with severe consequences for breaking it
The Sabbath can be ignored without consequence
Only priests are responsible for Sabbath observance
The Sabbath is a flexible guideline
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the Sabbath is mandatory, with severe consequences for breaking it
questions.explanation: Verses 14 and 15 explain that defiling the Sabbath by working leads to death or being cut off from the people, showing the seriousness of obeying God's command.

questions.question: What does Exodus 31 teach about God’s provision for His people’s needs in ministry and service?
options: God provides wisdom and skills to those He calls to serve
God expects people to figure out ministry on their own
Only natural talent is needed for ministry
questions.correctAnswer: God provides wisdom and skills to those He calls to serve
questions.explanation: The passage shows God filling Bezaleel and others with wisdom and knowledge to carry out the work commanded (Exodus 31:3-6), emphasizing divine provision for service.

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 emphasize the importance of faithfulness in following God’s commands in daily life?
options: By commanding the exact construction of the tabernacle and its furnishings
By allowing freedom to improvise in worship
By focusing on human creativity alone
By minimizing the significance of the law
questions.correctAnswer: By commanding the exact construction of the tabernacle and its furnishings
questions.explanation: Verses 7-11 instruct that everything must be made according to God’s specific commands, teaching obedience and faithfulness in ministry and daily life.

questions.question: A believer finds it hard to trust God’s timing for rest. How does Exodus 31 provide reassurance?
options: God rested on the seventh day and was refreshed, setting an example
Rest is optional and only cultural
questions.correctAnswer: God rested on the seventh day and was refreshed, setting an example
questions.explanation: Verse 17 highlights that God rested and was refreshed on the seventh day, modeling the importance of rest and renewing strength.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 31, the Sabbath is a perpetual covenant between God and Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:16 clearly states that the Sabbath is to be kept throughout generations as a perpetual covenant, showing its lasting significance.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 31 teaches that spiritual gifts and skills are given only to leaders and priests.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: While Bezaleel and Aholiab are highlighted, verse 6 mentions 'all that are wise hearted' receive wisdom, indicating spiritual gifts can be given broadly for service.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Exodus 31:18, Moses received two tables of testimony written with the _____ of God.
questions.correctAnswer: finger
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:18 states that the two tables of stone were written with the finger of God, emphasizing the divine origin of the commandments.

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 instruct believers about integrity and honesty in their work?
options: By requiring precise obedience in making the tabernacle and its furnishings
By focusing only on the outcome, not the process
By encouraging individual interpretation over God’s commands
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring precise obedience in making the tabernacle and its furnishings
questions.explanation: Verses 7-11 show God’s command to make everything exactly as instructed, teaching integrity and faithfulness in work.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with contentment in their work. What lesson from Exodus 31 might help?
options: God equips and values all types of skilled workmanship for His purposes
Only gold and silver work is valuable
Only spiritual work matters, not craftsmanship
Work is unimportant compared to rest
questions.correctAnswer: God equips and values all types of skilled workmanship for His purposes
questions.explanation: Verses 3-5 show the variety of skills God endowed Bezaleel with, including working with metals, stones, and wood, emphasizing the value of diverse skills in service.

questions.question: What does Exodus 31 teach about perseverance through trials related to obedience?
options: Obedience to God’s commands, including Sabbath rest, must be maintained even under threat of death
Obedience is optional during difficult times
God only requires obedience when convenient
Sabbath laws were temporary and not binding
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God’s commands, including Sabbath rest, must be maintained even under threat of death
questions.explanation: Verses 14-15 emphasize severe consequences for breaking the Sabbath, showing that perseverance in obedience is critical regardless of circumstances.

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 encourage humility and gratitude in believers’ service to God?
options: By acknowledging that all wisdom and skill come from God’s Spirit
By boasting about one’s own talents
By focusing on personal glory in ministry
questions.correctAnswer: By acknowledging that all wisdom and skill come from God’s Spirit
questions.explanation: Verses 3 and 6 emphasize that the Spirit of God fills people with wisdom and skill, teaching humility and thankfulness for God’s provision.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 31 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 31.

questions.question: Who was specifically called and filled with the Spirit of God to devise and execute the workmanship for the tabernacle?
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:2-3 states that Bezaleel, son of Uri, was called and filled with the Spirit of God in wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and workmanship.

questions.question: In addition to Bezaleel, who else was given wisdom by God to assist in the construction of the tabernacle?
questions.correctAnswer: Aholiab
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:6 identifies Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, as another skilled craftsman endowed with wisdom.

questions.question: Which tribes did Bezaleel and Aholiab belong to, respectively?
questions.correctAnswer: Judah and Dan
questions.explanation: Bezaleel was from the tribe of Judah and Aholiab from the tribe of Dan as stated in Exodus 31:2 and 31:6.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the Sabbath as described in Exodus 31?
options: It is a sign of sanctification between God and Israel
It is a day for agricultural rest only
It commemorates the Exodus from Egypt
It is a day for atonement rituals
questions.correctAnswer: It is a sign of sanctification between God and Israel
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 emphasizes the Sabbath as a sign between God and Israel that they may know He sanctifies them.

questions.question: According to Exodus 31, what is the penalty for anyone who does work on the Sabbath?
options: The soul shall be cut off from among his people
questions.correctAnswer: The soul shall be cut off from among his people
questions.explanation: Verses 14-15 clearly state that anyone who defiles the Sabbath by working shall be put to death or cut off from the people.

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 describe the Sabbath rest in relation to God's own creative work?
options: God rested and was refreshed on the seventh day
God created the Sabbath after the Exodus
God commanded the Sabbath to be a day of sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: God rested and was refreshed on the seventh day
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:17 connects the Sabbath rest to God's rest after creation, highlighting the typology of divine refreshment.

questions.question: What objects and items were the craftsmen commanded to make according to Exodus 31?
options: The tabernacle, ark, mercy seat, altars, holy garments, anointing oil, and incense
Only the ark and the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle, ark, mercy seat, altars, holy garments, anointing oil, and incense
questions.explanation: Verses 7-11 enumerate the detailed items to be made as commanded by God, including furniture and sacred garments.

questions.question: True or False: The tablets given to Moses on Mount Sinai were written by human hands.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:18 specifies that the tablets were written with the finger of God, indicating divine authorship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The Sabbath is described as a ______ covenant between God and the children of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: perpetual
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:16 defines the Sabbath observance as a perpetual covenant, meaning it is everlasting throughout generations.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'finger of God' in the context of the tablets of testimony?
options: It signifies direct divine intervention and authority
It refers to Moses' own writing
It symbolizes the work of angels
It is a metaphor for the Levites' role
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies direct divine intervention and authority
questions.explanation: The phrase 'finger of God' in Exodus 31:18 emphasizes that the Ten Commandments were inscribed by God's own power, underscoring divine authority.

questions.question: How does the description of skilled craftsmen in Exodus 31 reflect ancient Near Eastern cultural values?
options: Highly valuing specialized artisanship and divine inspiration in craftsmanship
Artisans were considered common laborers without special status
Only priests could craft sacred objects
Craftsmanship was secret and forbidden knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Highly valuing specialized artisanship and divine inspiration in craftsmanship
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:3-6 highlights the divine endowment of skill, reflecting the Near Eastern esteem for gifted artisans as essential to sacred construction.

questions.question: Which literary device is evident in the way the Sabbath is framed as a sign between God and Israel in Exodus 31?
questions.correctAnswer: Covenantal sign and theological foreshadowing
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 presents the Sabbath as a sign (ot) that sanctifies Israel, foreshadowing later covenantal themes in biblical theology.

questions.question: What is the parallel between God's rest on the seventh day and Israel's Sabbath according to Exodus 31?
options: God’s rest models and sanctifies Israel’s Sabbath rest
God rested to escape labor like Israel
The rest is only symbolic with no practical command
God’s rest is a metaphor for creation’s end
questions.correctAnswer: God’s rest models and sanctifies Israel’s Sabbath rest
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:17 shows a typological parallel where God’s rest provides the pattern and sanctification for Israel’s Sabbath observance.

questions.question: True or False: The construction of the tabernacle and its furnishings was solely the work of Moses and Aaron.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:2-6 reveals that skilled craftsmen like Bezaleel and Aholiab, filled with God's Spirit and wisdom, were responsible for the workmanship.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the authorial intent behind emphasizing the Sabbath command in Exodus 31?
options: To establish a perpetual covenant signifying God’s sanctifying presence
To introduce a new festival unrelated to earlier laws
questions.correctAnswer: To establish a perpetual covenant signifying God’s sanctifying presence
questions.explanation: The text in Exodus 31:12-17 underscores the Sabbath as an eternal sign of God's sanctification and covenant with Israel.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 31 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 31 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who did the LORD specifically call and fill with the Spirit of God to lead the workmanship for the tabernacle?
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:2-3 shows that God called Bezaleel by name, filled him with the Spirit of God in wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and workmanship. This exemplifies the divine empowerment for sacred tasks, consistent with God's gifting of artisans like Bezalel (Exodus 35:30-35) and the Spirit-inspired wisdom in the New Testament (1 Corinthians 12:4-11).

questions.question: Besides Bezaleel, who else did God endow with wisdom to assist in making all that He commanded?
questions.correctAnswer: Aholiab
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:6 states that God gave Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, wisdom alongside Bezaleel. This indicates God’s provision of gifted workers for His sacred purposes, a theme echoed in Exodus 35:34 and in the New Testament emphasis on spiritual gifts (Romans 12:6-8).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the Sabbath as described in Exodus 31?
options: A perpetual covenant and sign between God and Israel
A day to perform all work needed for worship
A ceremonial law no longer applicable
A day for community feasting only
questions.correctAnswer: A perpetual covenant and sign between God and Israel
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 and 31:16 describe the Sabbath as a perpetual covenant and a sign between God and Israel, signifying sanctification. This covenantal sign points to God’s holiness and rest, fulfilled ultimately in Christ (Hebrews 4:9-10) and reflecting God’s creation rest (Genesis 2:2-3).

questions.question: What consequence does Exodus 31 prescribe for anyone who profanes the Sabbath by working?
options: That soul shall be cut off from among his people
They shall offer a sin offering
They shall be forgiven after repentance
They shall be given a warning
questions.correctAnswer: That soul shall be cut off from among his people
questions.explanation: Verses 14-15 state that anyone who works on the Sabbath shall be put to death or cut off from the people, emphasizing the holiness of the day and the seriousness of obedience. This typifies God's holiness and judgment on sin (Leviticus 24:16; Ezekiel 20:12-13) and foreshadows the call for holiness in the New Testament (1 Thessalonians 4:7).

questions.question: What attribute of God is especially highlighted by His resting on the seventh day and commanding Israel to observe the Sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s holiness and sanctifying power
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:17 states the Sabbath is holy and a sign that God sanctifies Israel. God's rest after creation symbolizes His holiness and separation from sin, calling His people to be holy (Leviticus 19:2). The New Testament applies this sanctification through Christ (John 17:17; Hebrews 10:10).

questions.question: What were the two tables of testimony given to Moses according to Exodus 31:18?
options: Tables of stone written with the finger of God
Scrolls of the law given by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Tables of stone written with the finger of God
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:18 says God gave Moses two stone tablets written by His own finger, emphasizing divine authorship and authority of the law. This underscores the holiness and unchanging nature of God's covenant, a theme echoed in Deuteronomy 9:10 and referenced in the New Testament (2 Corinthians 3:3-7).

questions.question: What kinds of workmanship was Bezaleel filled with the spirit of God to perform?
options: Working in gold, silver, brass, cutting stones, carving timber
Only working with gold and silver
questions.correctAnswer: Working in gold, silver, brass, cutting stones, carving timber
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:3-5 describes Bezaleel’s divine endowment to work in various materials and craftsmanship, showing God’s provision of diverse gifts for His purposes. This illustrates the Spirit’s role in enabling service (Exodus 35:30-35; 1 Corinthians 12:4-11).

questions.question: According to Exodus 31, what is the purpose of the wisdom given to all the wise-hearted?
options: To make all that God commanded Moses
To govern the people of Israel
To prophesy about the coming Messiah
To perform miracles in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: To make all that God commanded Moses
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:6 explains that God placed wisdom in the hearts of all wise-hearted to complete the construction of the tabernacle and its furnishings as commanded. This points to the Spirit’s enabling role in fulfilling divine instructions (Exodus 35:31-32; 1 Corinthians 12:7).

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT explicitly mentioned as part of the tabernacle furnishings to be made?
questions.correctAnswer: The golden calf
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:7-9 lists the tabernacle items including the ark, altar of incense, and candlestick, but not the golden calf, which was a later idolatrous creation (Exodus 32). This distinguishes God’s holy sanctuary from human idolatry, confirming the call to worship the true God (Exodus 20:3-5; 1 Corinthians 10:14).

questions.question: What is the significance of the Sabbath as a sign between God and Israel 'throughout your generations'?
options: It signifies God's ongoing sanctification and covenant faithfulness
It is a temporary ordinance for Moses’ lifetime
It only applies during the wilderness journey
It is symbolic of agricultural rest only
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies God's ongoing sanctification and covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:13 and 31:16 emphasize the Sabbath as an eternal sign of God’s sanctifying work and covenant with Israel. This continuous sign points to God's faithfulness and holiness, a theme reflected in Jeremiah 31:33 and fulfilled in Christ’s rest (Hebrews 4:3-10).

questions.question: How does Exodus 31 portray the relationship between God's creative work and the institution of the Sabbath?
options: God rested on the seventh day after creation, making the Sabbath holy
God worked without rest and commanded Israel to do the same
The Sabbath was established as a harvest festival only
The Sabbath commemorates Israel’s exodus from Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: God rested on the seventh day after creation, making the Sabbath holy
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:17 links the Sabbath to God’s rest after six days of creation, establishing it as holy. This ties Sabbath observance to divine creation order (Genesis 2:2-3) and God's providential rest, a principle carried into the New Testament understanding of spiritual rest in Christ (Hebrews 4:4-10).

questions.question: What does the phrase 'written with the finger of God' in Exodus 31:18 imply about the nature of the Law?
options: The Law is divinely authored and authoritative
The Law was written by human scribes
The Law is subject to change
questions.correctAnswer: The Law is divinely authored and authoritative
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:18 emphasizes that the commandments were written by God's own finger, indicating divine origin and unchangeable authority. This affirms the holiness and trustworthiness of God's word (Deuteronomy 9:10; Psalm 40:8) and undergirds New Testament teachings on Scripture’s divine inspiration (2 Timothy 3:16).

questions.question: What role does the Spirit of God play in Exodus 31 concerning human ability and worship?
options: Empowers individuals with wisdom and ability to perform sacred tasks
Commands people to work without rest
Punishes those who do not build the tabernacle
Teaches people how to sacrifice animals
questions.correctAnswer: Empowers individuals with wisdom and ability to perform sacred tasks
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:3 and 31:6 reveal that the Spirit fills individuals with wisdom and knowledge to construct the tabernacle, showing God’s empowering presence in human service. This is consistent with Old Testament examples (Judges 14:6) and New Testament pneumatology (Acts 1:8; 1 Corinthians 12:4-11).

questions.question: Why is the Sabbath described as 'holy unto you' in Exodus 31?
options: Because God sanctifies His people and sets the Sabbath apart for rest
Because it is a day to gather all animals
Because it is a day to fast and mourn only
Because it is the day Moses received the Law
questions.correctAnswer: Because God sanctifies His people and sets the Sabbath apart for rest
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:14 calls the Sabbath holy unto Israel because it is a day God sanctifies for rest. This reflects God's sanctifying work in His covenant people (Leviticus 20:8) and prefigures Christ’s lordship over the Sabbath (Mark 2:27-28).

questions.question: Which tribe did Bezaleel belong to, according to Exodus 31?
questions.correctAnswer: Judah
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:2 states Bezaleel was the son of Uri, from the tribe of Judah. This highlights God's use of diverse tribal representatives in sacred service (cf. Numbers 1:5-15) and reflects the unity of Israel in worship.

questions.question: What is included in 'the holy garments' mentioned in Exodus 31:10?
options: Garments for Aaron the priest and his sons to minister
questions.correctAnswer: Garments for Aaron the priest and his sons to minister
questions.explanation: Exodus 31:10 specifies holy garments for Aaron and his sons to wear in priestly ministry, signifying consecration and holiness (Leviticus 8:7-9). This foreshadows Christ as our High Priest (Hebrews 4:14-16).
